ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Topics that I previously don't know well enough, like itinerant magnetism.

Solid State Physics,
Superconductor, Magnetism, Tight Binding, and so on

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The material chosen to be covered was exceptionally interesting, and the indepth discussions of magnetism and electron-phonon coupling I have not encountered in other courses. I wish that the material used Green's functions and more advanced techniques to cover each of the sections, specifically with magnetism, where the coverage of the topic was not rigorous.
The instructor was highly motivated in teaching and delivered important information very efficiently and deeply

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, definitely! Anyone who wants to know "theory in the eyes of an experimentalist" should take this course.
If students want to study more about Solid State Physics after taking SSP1, I recommend this course.
